page.title: 12IRVINE ** SCHOOL MEALS
page.content: Over the years{school dinners}have been given rather a bad name, what with grouchy dinner ladies and mushy peas. But in{Dreghorn Primary School, the children say their school dinners'are great'. The menu is chosen by Mrs Kerr,the head-cook, not the headmistress. Although there are some special foods that must be in the meals every day, on the whole, the children have a very varied menu. In some schools you have perhaps fish every Monday, steak pie every Tuesday and so on. Not so D.P.S. During a month,you might get fish only once,and steak pie 3 times. The food is bought from local distributors.Roughly 95 children attend school dinnners each day,the meals are made up both {nutritionally and economically}but with nutrition at the top of the list.
